title: I sincerely want to know. Why do people troll?
body:
I doubt I will get a sincere answer but I figured it might be a "I don't troll, but I have a FRIEND" sort of thing. I am a pretty funny guy so I feel bad for people who aren't or think they are so they try to joke all the time. I always thought that maybe it was that reason that I didn't get trolling. It's like a joke that only someone that isn't funny, thinks is funny. 

I didn't think that anyone started as a troll. Most people I figure say, "that game looks cool. I think I would like to be good at that." Then somewhere along the line, it gets boring or something? Maybe you never get as good as you hoped you would be? I just want to know. I really am curious. 

Explain the joke cause I will never get it.

One of the most common reasons that I see are because people are super-negative, they think the game is lost even though it isn't, and so they start to troll to get the game over quicker despite the fact that no one else wants to surrender and the other players still think they can make a comeback and win.

People troll because their life outside the game is stressful and they feel like they're failing. They wish to spread their misery by making others feel their pain. Its a similar reason why you have these loud bozos in ranked unable to see their own failings and TALK IN CAPS LIKE THIS. They're feeding their own egos to feel better after a crappy day at school or the office. 

Trolling is a sign of insecurity and a feeling of social inadequacy, they attempt to attract attention by causing chaos (its a fancy way to call for help). How do I know this? I used to be a troll,  both in video games and real life. I no longer do this crap because it doesn't help and I can better serve myself and others by being nice, constructive, and just pleasant fellow by not letting my frustration bleed over on to the internet and games I may be playing.

When i was VERY new to the game, I didnt realize that it was even possible to make a comeback. First blood was a death sentence and the rest of the game was just waiting until they destroyed nexus, or you surrendered.
So, therefor, why take the game seriously, and why not always surrender? 
So I intentionally fed. Ran under their towers, tried to "touchdown" into their base, anything to make my teammates give up and surrender the game we had already lost. 

I don't remember HOW i came to the realization (i was somehow never punished), but somehow I realized that you COULD win, even with a terrible early game, and that my feeding was actually really toxic and hurt people. 
I guess some people never realize? might be one reason.
cool story, Bro. tell it again. No really! Tell it to every bronze you see. Maybe you can stop the spread of feeders. We needs some words of inspiration to stem the tide.

People troll cus they're spoiled little shits who don't get their way. They either autofilled, or didn't get the champ they wanted. And cus they can - cus Riot is more interested in protecting these sensitive souls, cus "words hurt". This doesn't just happen in League of Legends. It happens everywhere. People troll over the internet cus it has no real consequences for them, cus they're anonymous, and nobody's monitoring them. 
Now, if these snowflakes were punished by someone in real life over the stupid shit they do and say to people online, on the same level as they would be in real life, they would be too scared to do anything. It's what elementary school kids do until they get a beating. 
I also think it's a problem that riot just lets them keep playing. Should maybe learn from World of Warcraft and have people pay monthly to play. F2P games are more often than not troll infested. People dont invest money in trolling. 
Also, riot games need to change their ban policy. Dont ban players for telling trolls to stop trolling. You have a chat function in an online multiplayer game! People are gonna talk shit!

No i don't think so.  Sometimes people (or at least me) need to be pushed past a brink to be able to reassess themselves from a different perspective.

You know, once, I felt a sort of satisfaction when I made someone really angry in soloqueue... that person was someone who was going duo top as amumu with garen. I was going solo top as teemo with a jungler, and I had to have killed this amumu like.... 12 times. This was back before I was level 10, so duo top was a thing, and being alone was bad news for me, not being a smurf. Except this time.

As the mummy player began to produce curses of his own with increased frequency, getting more kills on him was much more fun as I saw him throw a tantrum in all chat. Now, provided, he was spamming crl+4 at the beginning of the game, so it was somewhat justified that the cocky Amumu player got his comeuppance, but I get it; you make someone so mad they're foaming out the mouth... it's kinda fun to watch... sometimes. Now, as bad a person as that makes me, I don't make a point of feeding intentionally; in fact when I end up feeding I join in on my team's frustration.

I presume that trolls do the same thing; they make people mad and enjoy the mess that they created, but they piss off the wrong people. Whether they don't feel like trying, or aren't good at this game, they feed intentionally and make their own team rage instead of the enemy. That's not cool, because when you shut someone down that hard, you ruin one person's day. You feed that hard on purpose, you ruin 4 people's days.
I just don't understand the loss of your own 20-40 minutes. Did you go in planning to lose when the game started? I want to know when someone decides they don't want to win anymore.

Honestly,  I don't know. Like I said, I don't fully understand why people do this, and I don't purposely lose games. I do end up feeding some games, but that's usually when my team doesn't cooperate and an enemy gets fed, or I'm just getting outplayed.

Maybe they think that 4 times the angry people means 4 times the fun? Either way, like I said, these people would be great to play with if they just got good instead of being bad. But hey, that would require some work, right? And of course they go into ranked because it's easier to get a reaction out of people that have something at stake.
